title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. I, pt. 197 - Regulation Relating To The Granting Of Farm Labor Contractor Certificates Of Registration, Migrant Labor Registration Certificates, And Farm Labor Camp Commissary Permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. I, pt. 197 - Regulation Relating To The Granting Of Farm Labor Contractor Certificates Of Registration, Migrant Labor Registration Certificates, And Farm Labor Camp Commissary Permits

State Regulations
§ 197.1 - Purpose
§ 197.2 - Definitions
§ 197.3 - Applications for permits and certificates
§ 197.4 - Issuance, denial and revocation of permits and certificates
§ 197.5 - Five-day supplemental application
§ 197.6 - Permit to operate farm labor camp commissary
§ 197.7 - Possession of certificates
§ 197.8 - Copies of approved certificate applications
§ 197.9 - Payroll records, wage statement and commissary record requirements
§ 197.10 - Interview of workers
§ 197.11 - Hearings

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. I, pt. 197

Statutory authority: Labor Law, §212-a, subd. 9, and
§ 212-b, subd. 6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
